intro: Streptocarpus macropodus, commonly known as the large-flowered streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for greenhouse cultivation. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant among horticultural enthusiasts.
